reviews.review_msg: What, does anyone under fifty automatically get rated "hot"? Sheesh. Too much looking at the screen: Power tends to corrupt, Powerpoint corrupts absolutely. Walk away from the slideshow nanny, Shane. Take off yer training wheels & learn how to freestyle like the big kids (ala McCarron). You can do it! Do it! Cut the cord!  Plenty smart, but nervous

takin poli.econ. w/ him was not that easy as u might expected.he talks fast in mono-tone kinda. keep in mind to go on on'line and listen again. but he indeed is a funny and organized prof.and "YOUNG" too! haha:)

lol - Kinda cute how he tries soo hard to be on top of things and make himself sound intelligent.  Nevertheless, he's an amazing prof, and he definitely does know his stuff.  He's also VERY clear and VERY organized.  Maybe a little more passion to top the icing.

His lectures are very helpful if you take proper notes of each and everything he says! He repeats himself and emphasizes important points. He is a very good prof. 240 is a hard course but I don't think he could make it any easier. He is funny too.

Best pedagogy ever. Interesting content and all-around informative. Lecture slides are a gem but his lectures are even better because he really knows how to teach for your understanding. I think he understands that international students struggle with English so he articulates clearly. I was marked by TA, not him.

Enda is a great teacher who is, evidently, very passionate about this subject. Although the work load is relatively heavy (readings, exams, papers, etc.), it's mostly manageable. Make sure you can connect everything back to the PEC approach - critical to your success! Do the readings and attend lecture.
I actually enjoy this class a lot! Enda's sense of humor making the class even more interesting. If you're interested in politics and social issues, this is the perfect class for you!

Enda is approachable, and always more than willing to help. I have had him before, and he was great. However, the criteria in CMNS240 is vague and confusing. I did not have much interest in the topic, and the material itself is very boring. Enda tries making lectures interesting, but there is only so much he can do.  Also, he can be a tough grader.
I found him to be very kind but some of his readings are hard to read though
Really enjoyed the class though it was repetitious of other classes in the CMNS field. Opened my eyes to some very interesting topics and loved his enthusiasm and passion for the material.
Great prof, great class. Enda is clear and concise, honest and helpful.
Excellent speaker. His lectures are super interesting!
One thing I've noticed about Enda is that he really cares about his students. CMNS240 is by no means a super interesting course but I found his class to be very insightful.

Possibly the best lectures you will ever sit through. Unbelievably clear lectures that make excellent study material for the midterm. If you pay attention and take good notes, you will do well. Does a great job communicating information to students and structures the class well. Highly recommended prof.

Enda was VERY clear about concepts that you NEED to know for the exams/paper. The lectures are super structured and insightful. If you're interested in politics at all, you will definitely find this course interesting. I expected to dread this course, and it has become my favourite thus far!
Good prof, but horrendous course. It's unfortunate because he seems like he really cares about his students.
Lectures are dense but interesting. Grading was easy.
Easy class, and she is very nice, but lectures are mind numbing.  Endless talking with no interaction.  Talks for the whole 2 hours.
Her lectures are very dry and hard to catch up even though the concepts are not that hard to manage, even though she is a passionate lecturer.

The course contents are dry (especially the reading), but this is definitely not a dissolute course. The bulk of the exams were based on her lecture slides. (make sure to include some examples from news articles or reading and you'll be ok!) She gave even more help than the TA! Awesome prof!

Anis changed my view of Facebook, Apple and Google forever. I'll never look at Apple products same way after taking this course. Readings are hard and often boring but eye-opening lectures and friendly tutorials. Must attend lectures if u want a grade above B in exams
Hard to score in exams.

Worst lecturer I have ever experienced in my university career. Incomprehensible English to the point where you wonder if shes actually real. Attending lectures is useless, teach yourself the whole course. She does not make a semblance of sense, and probably never will. Awful, awful professor.
Very difficult to understand her. Was useless going to lecture.
Really really really hard to understand what she is trying to say thanks to her terrible accents. I got nothing out of the lectures.

She speaks pretty soft and slow in lecture so it can get pretty dull. But she's super friendly and smart, so if you don't get anything asking in tutorial or office hour is useful. I didn't think I would like political economy but I actually learned a lot from her :)

Fen is a lovely person. She is intelligent and approachable. In tutorial she was great and I could understand her better. As a lecturer though, I found that her accent really limited my comprehension. As a result, I would not take another class with her, unfortuantely. She doesn't speak English strongly enough to lecture a class, they were brutal.

Most ridiculous prof I've ever had. I attended most lectures and every single time I would wind up frustrated because I couldn't understand a word she was saying. I really feel like I wasted my money with this class.

Really hard to understand but has good slides that she posts on-line. I honestly didn't learn much though and the readings were completely all over the place and her lectures seemed to be vaguely related to the readings (I may not have been able to understand enough to make the connection though haha...)
Her English is pretty much incomprehensible, which makes taking notes in lecture extremely difficult. She seems passionate about the course, but she needs to work on her public speaking skills.
Dal is much respected by his students. Though there is a language barrier he makes great, informative slides that basically sum up readings. Would definitely take his class again  :)
can be hard to understand sometimes and can mumble but just bear with him! His slides are packed with information. Always willing to help.

His thick accent makes him REALLY hard to understand during lecture, plus he stutters quite a bit and repeats himself. I appreciated his lecture notes though - clear & understandable... with perfect English. Class was alright. I liked that he often used popular ideas as examples, ie he showed the Gangnam Style MV in class once.
his lecture is boring and useless.
He's linear with the marking, nice person. But he's accent is hard to understand sometimes...
deadadadaaaa is all i have to say. great and sweet prof! take his class :)

Mr. Jin is a fantastic teacher. He simplifies the concepts clearly for students. His exams are straightforward if you attend his lectures. His notes are thorough. Despite his accent, he speaks better English than most English teachers. If in doubt, take any class that he teaches. He definitely thinks about how to teach so that students learn.
A great lecturer. Courses are challenging but enlightening.
I went to 2 different classes in 2 separate semesters and decided not to take his course for the same reason: because he keeps yawning during his lecturing.

The content in this course is in no way boring, yet, he makes it sound dull. No slides, no recordings, and no aid during midterms and the final exam. Asked if he could go over key terms/themes and/or key theorists and was told no by the TA as well. It's a second-year course, students need some help. Do not recommend this instructor.

Difficult to follow because there are no slides. I cannot follow what's being said and when I do, I don't know which parts are important and what is filler. Having slides that tell you the key points on what's being said is supremely helpful so students can follow along.

Currently taking his class for CMNS240. The comment below does not understand that Matthew stressed the importance of listening and taking notes, rather than copying off of a lecture slide. You have to be attentive or else you will miss key details, but other than that, he seems to be very interested in the topics and is also very knowledgeable.

Does not understand that people need visuals aids to learn. CONSTANTLY stops to drink water/coffee and has no flow to his lectures that he doesn't record or posts notes/slides for. Even when the class asked him to make notes he said no. Lol. 10/10 do not recommend. Wish I could give him a 0.
Great TA. She did a better job in explaining the political economic concept than the instructor did. very helpful!
